intro: Anisanthus huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén's anisanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pale yellow. Anisanthus huillensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
